name: Korean Kebabs
author: Kruct
summary: This is a juicy dish and really easy to prepare. I have made these for years and they're still a huge favorite with family and friends. I serve them with mushroom rice and garlic bread. This is a sauceless recipe but the meat is so succulent you don't need it.
ingredients: ⅛ teaspoon red chile powder, or to taste
salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
1 ½ pounds pork tenderloin, cut into cubes
1  onion, cut into chunks, or to taste
1 (8 ounce) package fresh mushrooms, or to taste
1 large red bell pepper, cut into chunks, or to taste
1  zucchini, cut into chunks, or to taste
directions: Mix oil, soy sauce, and peanut butter together in a bowl until blended and creamy
Stir in spring onion, sesame seeds, garlic, red chile powder, salt, and pepper
Add pork to marinade; turn to coat
Marinate pork in the refrigerator for 2 to 4 hours
Preheat oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C)
Line a rimmed baking sheet with aluminum foil
Thread pork, onion, mushrooms, red bell pepper, and zucchini onto skewers
Bake in the preheated oven until pork is tender and browned, about 30 minutes
